questions.question: Which space exploration site, located in Kazakhstan, is known as the world's first and largest spaceport, from where Yuri Gagarin embarked on his historic journey in 1961?
questions.context: This site has launched many significant missions, including those for the International Space Station, and remains operational today for both Russian and international space missions.

questions.question: What museum in New York, designed by Frank Lloyd Wright, opened its doors in 1959 and is renowned for its unique spiral architecture?

answer.label: Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, New York City

questions.context: This museum is home to an extensive collection of Impressionist, Post-Impressionist, Modern, and Contemporary art, and its building is considered an architectural icon.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium marked a decisive end to the Napoleonic Wars in 1815?
questions.context: This site witnessed the defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte and has various monuments and museums dedicated to this pivotal moment in European history.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Peru is often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas' and remained hidden from outsiders until its discovery by Hiram Bingham in 1911?
questions.context: This 15th-century Incan citadel is situated on a mountain ridge and is one of the most recognizable symbols of the Inca Empire.

questions.question: What UNESCO World Heritage Site in India, completed in 1653, was commissioned by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal?
questions.context: This white marble mausoleum is considered an architectural masterpiece and attracts millions of visitors every year from around the globe.
